host.name: Mr. Fluffbutt
traits: Sits on a special throne-like perch
Has a hidden soft spot (though he'd never admit it)
host.description: Mr. Fluffbutt is a regal Persian cat who considers himself royalty. Despite his sassy attitude, he secretly enjoys helping children learn math - though he'd never admit it!

intro.title: Are You Smarter Than Mr. Fluffbutt?
intro.subtitle: Welcome to Chapter 1: Help Me Get This Bike!
intro.opening_greeting: Well, well... what do we have here? Another human daring to challenge MY intellectual superiority? I am Mr. Fluffbutt, the most brilliant feline mind in Lake Bluff. Since you've dared to enter my domain, shall we see if you're smarter than a genius cat?
intro.description: Meet Hudson, a determined young human who dreams of owning a shiny new bike. But bikes aren't cheap - this one costs $500! Hudson has decided to start a cat-sitting business to earn money. Let's help him track his progress and solve some money math problems along the way!
intro.progress_message: Listen up, tiny humans! Hudson has managed to scrape together a whopping $10 - that's a mere 2% of his $500 bike goal! At this rate, he'll get that bike right around the time I decide to be nice to the neighborhood dogs... which is NEVER!

name_selection.title: State Your Name, Tiny Human!
name_selection.greeting: Before we begin, tiny human, I require something to call you by. Other than 'hey you' or 'human number 47.' What's your name?

age_selection.title: Reveal Your Years of Wisdom!
age_selection.greeting: And how many years have you been roaming this Earth? Do try to be honest.

age_responses.6-7: Ah, a young kitten still. We'll start with the easy numbers.
age_responses.8-10: Getting close to double digits? Let's see if your math skills match your age.
age_responses.too_young: Too young! Come back when you've learned to count past your whiskers!
age_responses.too_old: Oh my, practically ancient for a human! But still no match for feline wisdom.
age_responses.silly: Very funny. I suppose you think you're more clever than a cat? Try again!

sassy_responses: Oh my whiskers! Are you trying to be funny? Even my afternoon naps are more serious than this. Your REAL age, if you please!
*sigh* I see we have a jester in my mathematical court. Let's try this ONE more time, tiny human!
age_selection.final_warning: Enough games! Choose your true age now, or it's back to mathematical kindergarten with you!

goof_options.ship: I'm as old as Mr. Fluffbutt's royal lineage

questions.question: Let's start with something simple: How much money did Hudson have when he woke up this morning?

host_reactions.correct: Ah yes, zero dollars - just like the number of times I've been wrong!
host_reactions.incorrect: Zero brain cells were used in calculating that answer!

questions.question: Pay attention now: How many dollars did I allow Hudson to earn for keeping me company?

host_reactions.correct: Ten dollars is correct. I see you can count higher than a goldfish.
host_reactions.incorrect: Wrong! Did you learn math from a squirrel?

questions.question: If Hudson manages to entertain me for TWO whole days, how much will he earn?

host_reactions.correct: Twenty dollars! Perhaps there's hope for you yet, tiny human.
host_reactions.incorrect: Incorrect! My litterbox has better numbers than that.

questions.question: Count the days, human: How many days is it from Monday to Friday?

host_reactions.correct: Five days - finally, someone who can count as high as my IQ!
host_reactions.incorrect: Are you even trying? My afternoon nap is more productive!

questions.question: If Hudson saves his pennies for three days of cat-sitting, how much will he have?

host_reactions.correct: Thirty dollars! Almost as impressive as my whisker-counting abilities.
host_reactions.incorrect: That answer is as wrong as a dog trying to meow!

questions.question: If I let Hudson cat-sit for 4 days, how much money will he earn?

host_reactions.correct: Forty dollars! Your mathematical prowess is almost cat-like... almost.
host_reactions.incorrect: Pathetic! Even my scratching post could calculate better.

questions.question: Hudson earned $10 today. How many more days of cat-sitting does he need to have $50?

host_reactions.correct: Four days! You're starting to think like a cat accountant!
host_reactions.incorrect: Wrong! Maybe stick to counting kibble pieces.

questions.question: If Hudson saves $10 each day, how much will he have after 6 days?

host_reactions.correct: Sixty dollars! Your counting skills are improving... for a human.
host_reactions.incorrect: That's so incorrect, it made my whiskers curl!

questions.question: How much would Hudson earn if he cat-sat for me for one whole week?

host_reactions.correct: Seventy dollars! Almost as impressive as my napping skills.
host_reactions.incorrect: Ha! Just as I suspected - no match for feline intelligence!

questions.question: If Hudson has $10 now, how much more does he need to reach $100?

host_reactions.correct: Ninety dollars! Ending strong, just like my napping game.
host_reactions.incorrect: Is that your final answer? How embarrassing for you.

perfect: Impossible! A human matching my mathematical brilliance? I demand a recount... but fine, you've earned my respect. Temporarily.
Well, well... I must admit, you've impressed even this genius cat. *licks paw dismissively*
high: Well, well... not entirely hopeless after all. You might be worthy of attending my advanced calculus class for kittens.
Not bad for a human! You might be worthy of joining my mathematical court someday.
medium: Average performance - just like I'd expect from a species that can't even land on their feet. Keep practicing, human.
Mediocre, just like most humans. But I sense potential...
low: Oh, the shame! Even my neighbor's goldfish could do better. Come back when you've studied the ancient art of feline mathematics.
Oh dear, oh dear. Even a sleeping kitten could do better!
